tests.sic.sST.norm

Class sSTCnorm

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.sST.norm.sSTCnorm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, FunctionIntf
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    sSTCnormBoxed

    public class sSTCnorm
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a normal process with parameters N(μ T, σ2T) with μ,σ>0. The system faces linear holding and backorder costs with cost rates h>0 and p>0 and optionally, lost-sales costs p̂≥0. It also faces fixed costs: fixed review cost per period Kr≥0, and fixed order cost Ko≥0. Finally, there is a constant lead-time for each order being placed equal to L≥0. The control parameters then, are s (the reorder point), S (the order-up-to point), and T (the review interval). It is known that the policy itself is the optimal policy for controlling the long-run expected costs of such a single-echelon installation.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2021

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
                   java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs as well as lost-sales costs, and fixed review and order costs controlled by the (s,S,T) periodic review policy.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - double[] representing s, S and T or DblArray1Vector
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Kr",$val> pair
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if the computations go awry, see method evalBoth(x).

      • evalBoth

        Pair evalBoth(java.lang.Object x,
              java.util.HashMap param)
        evaluate the long-run expected cost of a single echelon inventory control system facing normal demands with linear holding and backorder costs and optionally lost-sales costs, and fixed review and order costs controlled by the (s,S,T) periodic review policy. It returns a pair of doubles, both the actual value as well as the value when the order cost Ko is zero, forming a lower bound on the cost function.
        Parameters:
        x - double[] or popt4jlib.DblArray1Vector representing s, S and T
        param - HashMap // may contain a <"Kr",$val> pair
        Returns:
        utils.Pair // Pair<Double result, Double lowerbound>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - unchecked if Po is computed outside [0,1] or if any number computed turns out to be Double.NaN.

      • sum1

        private static double sum1(double r,
                           double R,
                           double T,
                           double t,
                           double l,
                           double sigma,
                           double m,
                           double IC,
                           double phat,
                           double p2,
                           double ceps)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        computes the sum in the nominator of the fraction that represents the holding and backorder (and possibly lost-sales) costs.
        Parameters:
        r - double reorder point
        R - double order-up-to point
        T - double review period length
        t - double lead-time
        l - double demand rate miu
        sigma - double demand standard deviation
        m - double lead-time demand rate
        IC - double holding cost rate
        phat - double back-order penalty cost rate
        p2 - double lost-sales penalty cost
        ceps - double convergence threshold for the summation
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sum2

        private static double sum2(double r,
                           double R,
                           double T,
                           double l,
                           double sigma,
                           double ceps,
                           double cmpl)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        computes the sum of the first term in the denominator of the fraction that represents holding and penalty costs. This sum, together with the complementary norm CDF at the right point, represents the inverse of the probability of ordering Po.
        Parameters:
        r - double reorder point
        R - double order-up-to point
        T - double review period length
        l - double demand mean rate
        sigma - double demand standard deviation
        ceps - double convergence threshold for the summation
        cmpl - double used to check that the denom is greater than or equal to one.
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • complnormcdf

        private static double complnormcdf(double x,
                                   double mi,
                                   double sigma)
        evaluate the function Φ̄(x,μ,σ), ie the complementary CDF of the normal distribution N(μ, σ2). Uses the cern.jet.random.Normal class of the COLT library for scientific computing.
        Parameters:
        x - double
        mi - double
        sigma - double must be >0.
        Returns:
        double

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        invoke as java -cp <classpath> tests.sic.sST.norm.sSTCnorm <s> <S> <T> <Kr> <Ko> <L> <μ> <σ> <h> <p> [p2(0)]. The constraints on the variables and parameters values are as follows:
        • S≥s
        • T≥(3.5*σ/μ)^2
        • σ>0
        • h>0
        • p>0
        • p2≥0
        All numbers (except s and S) must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]

      • integrate

        public static double integrate(FunctionIntf f,
                               double a,
                               double b,
                               VectorIntf x0)
        helper static method to allow the integration of the function f according to its 1st variable in the interval [a,b]. The function f must accept VectorIntf argument as input, and it is assumed that it is the first variable in the vector that the integration is about. The requested accuracy is _INTEGRAL_APPROX_EPS.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf
        a - double the left end of the interval.
        b - double the right end of the interval
        Returns:
        double the result of applying Simpson rule for integration.
